definition: to bow one's head in acknowledgment of guilt/to admit one's guilt

sentences.english: Confession is the first step to repentance.
He pleaded guilty to the lesser charge of unlawful sexual intercourse.
sentences.chinese: 他曾就情節較輕的“非法性行爲”一項指控認罪。

sentences.english: Her guilty conscience ate at her until she finally confessed.
sentences.chinese: 她地良心不斷地啃蝕她，直到她認罪。

sentences.english: Confessing my sin is good for my health.
sentences.chinese: 向神認罪是對屬靈健康有益的。

sentences.english: If both confess, they will each be jailed 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們同時認罪，他們就要被監禁15年。

sentences.english: Tupikova confessed her guilt and is now awaiting sentencing.
sentences.chinese: 圖皮科瓦已認罪，目前正等待判決結果。

sentences.english: I waive my constitutional rights against self-incrimination.
The judge promised leniency if the offender confessed.
sentences.chinese: 如果罪犯認罪，法官答應從寬發落。

sentences.english: This sinner has confessed her sins and begged for absolution and forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 這名罪人已經認罪，並祈求赦免和寬恕。

sentences.english: The defendant decided to cop a plea in order to get a lighter sentence.
sentences.chinese: 被告人決定認罪以求從輕處理。

sentences.english: The self-confessed killer has also been banned from reading newspapers or watching broadcast news.
sentences.chinese: 這個公開認罪的犯人同時被禁止閱讀報紙或收看電視。

sentences.english: Although conclusive evidence, but Hong Lin still has pleaded not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 雖然證據確鑿，但林洪還是拒不認罪。

sentences.english: His attorney, Benjamin Brafman, said in an email to Reuters Strauss-Kahn "will plead not guilty."
sentences.chinese: 其律師B在給露透社K的郵件中說，將不會認罪。

sentences.english: Liu accused pleaded guilty to a better attitude, as appropriate leniently punished.
sentences.chinese: 被告人劉某認罪態度較好，酌情予以從輕處罰。

sentences.english: I have heard thousands of confessions, but never one of covetousness .
sentences.chinese: 我聽過千萬人認罪，但無一是爲貪婪認罪。

definition: to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
to demand payment of money owing
